fields.description:
When connecting JIRA to an LDAP directory, the *User Password Attribute* in the User Schema Settings doesn't actually do anything. 
For example, I have set it to "foobar". But users are still able to authenticate with their LDAP passwords successfully. 

According to the [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+to+an+LDAP+Directory], the User Password Attribute is used for:
{quote}
The attribute field to use when loading a user's password. 
{quote}
So technically, this is the attribute used to retrieve the user's password for authentication, but JIRA is not following it. 

*Tested with: OpenLDAP*
fields.summary: User Password Attribute in LDAP configuration doesn't do anything

There are no hints on ajax actions in progress. This is very confusing when action takes more than 1-2 seconds.

For example:
# Go to Issue navigator, select filter in the left column, stare at screen wondering if anything is going on, stare a bit more, start worrying, click randomly around, check internet connection, boom! see results
# Now open first issue, click next, stare at screen wondering if anything is going on, boom! see the next issue.

There should always be a visual hint on ajax action in progress. Maybe it's possible to show this only if action takes more than a second to complete.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40548].
  {panel}

I found a bug within the rest API while we were testing our interface to JIRA, fetching issues from JIRA. 

After creating an issue with 5000 'ä' we get a python error on our side:

UnicodeDecodeError: 'utf8' codec can't decode bytes in position 8197-8198: invalid data

Usually this means encoding is set wrong, but in this case, JIRA sends wrong UTF8 Data. 

\xc3\xa4 stands for 'ä' in the utf-8 encoding tab. After 3779 of \xc3\xa4 JIRA adds some extra bytes '\r\nb2c\r\n'.This cuts through the byte of \xc3 and \xa4 making the data unreadable causing the decode error.

Problem does not exist with 3000 'ä'
fields.summary: Rest API: Wrong UTF8 Data

  {panel}

If your Activity stream has a limit of 10 entries and you add a filter (for Example, 'Issue Created') the filtered list will not be 10 entries. Instead it will only display the X items in the list of 10 that match the filter.

*Example:*
Activity Stream has a limit of 5 items displayed at once:
Event type is Issue Created
The 4 most recent actions are comments
Only 1 item is shown in the Activity Stream.

For clarity, it should display 10 items of the desired type. As this can confuse users are they will see 'no activity' when if their last event has been pushed off by other non-visible events.
fields.summary: Activity Stream should take filter into account for Item Display Limit

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40528].
  {panel}

When using the Activity Stream gadget there are currently only 4 filter options:
Project
JIRA Issue Key
Update Date
Username

It would be extremely useful to be able to filter any combination of categories or actions including resolution, Workflow Transitions, time logged, etc. 

Another approach would be to allow users to create a search filter & then to stream either general or specific activity on tickets falling under that search filter.

Additionally, the constraint of Display Options > Limit to XX Items is overly rigid. Would be very useful to be able to constrain to a time period, ie. 8 hours, 1 week, etc. up to a configurable max number of items.

EX:
Activity stream showing every time a user in the CS Group transitioned a ticket from "Resolved" to "In QA" over the past 24 hours. Show 20 Results + link to full list.

EX: 
Activity stream showing every time CurrentUser() commented a ticket forever. Show 5 results + link to full list.
fields.summary: Activity Stream should have more filter options

h3. ***Current Behaviour***
It is possible to set the the recipients of notifications to 
- Current Assignee
- Reporter
- Current User
- Project Lead
- Component Lead
- Single User
- Group
- Project Role
- Single Email Address
- All Watchers
- User Custom Field Value
- Group Custom Field Value

h3. ***Feature Request***
It would be great to add an additional condition as such the notification is sent to certain individuals from the project roles.

bq. For example, we would like to have the option to send the Issue Created notification, not to ALL Current Assignees, but only to one/few users that I would specifically select to be notified on that event.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40519].
  {panel}

When someone does a "re-assign" or an initial assign, it is often desirable to perform actions based on the "re-assign".

One idea would be to allow for "generic" transactions per "workflow scheme".
- assign would be such a "generic" transaction and could have the same three attributes as a standard state transition:
- condition (if false hide the "Assign" button, example - you could only allow "Assign" if state IN "Open, Re-Opened) ...)
- validator (could check if fields are filled, ...)
- post-action (could force the issue to go back to "Open" state)

Edit could be handled in a similar fashion. I have seen support requests and bug reports that requested this.

Every workflow could specify the attributes that apply to workflow transitions for specific "transactions" that do not constitute a "state transition"
fields.summary: The "Assign" action should have similar properties like a state transition

h3. Summary of the problem

In the Issue Collector, it is possible for any user to access the URL used in the Issue Collector script (the source portion especially), and use it to potentially spam the instance with it.  # Create a Issue Collector for a project
 # When using the Issue Collector, access the browser developer tool (for example, F12 for Chrome)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40502].
  {panel}

At present, you are only able to configure the starting date of the Created vs. Resolved chart by setting a value for number of days previously.  While this is generally helpful, I find myself having to frequently update the gadget to display the desired timeline.  It also includes all issue types, whereas I have a need to understand how many Defects are incoming versus New Features.

Request:  As a project manager, I would like to be able to set a start date for the chart in the gadget configuration OR use the existing number of days prior configuration.

Use Case:  Our projects often have continuous testing, and I would like to be able to have a chart that shows the created/resolved defects based on the start date of a of testing for that particular project or Sprint.  To accomplish this, I would need to be able to only view created/resolved defects beginning from a defined date, not a floating date.

The ability to have that kind of quality view across multiple sprints for a given version is immensely valuable.  One of the key things I want to be able to see is the point at which the resolved tickets surpass the created tickets.  At that point I begin to have confidence that we're trending towards our completion date.  If we're halfway through our schedule for the version, and our created defects are still outpacing our resolved defects, I know I have a serious quality problem to address.
fields.summary: Allow additional configurations of the Created vs. Resolved chart (Start Date and Issue Type)
Time Tracking Report: Enabling option to choose Sprint instead of Fix Version

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40486].
  {panel}

In Projet Issue View, all provided links are based on generic concept and predefined filters (in system-preset-filters-sections.xml), and their translation causes 

All these filters refer about list of issues following different filters, and may return between 0 to n issues.
In French, "Issue" is translated "Demande" which is feminine name, and adjectives have to agree in gender and number.

Then for all i18n key work based on an adjective, English has no need to make a difference between singular and plural, but not in French. I will not try to explain in English special rule related the usage of verb "Avoir" (to have) and "Etre" (To be), but it has also an impact on how we write adjectives.

By exemple, i18n key like "common.filters.<adjective>" should be translated with plural and feminine
{code}
common.filters.addedrecently=Ajout\u00E9es r\u00E9cemment
common.filters.updatedrecently=Mises \u00E0 jour r\u00E9cemment
common.filters.assignedtome=Qui me sont attribu\u00E9es

common.filters.reportedbyme=Que j''ai rapport\u00E9s
common.filters.unscheduled=Non planifi\u00E9es
{code}

Some other is correclty translated :
{code}
common.filters.resolvedrecently=R\u00E9solues r\u00E9cemment
{code}

And "common.filters.outstanding" has been translated "Unresolved" like "common.concepts.unresolved", but due to the associated filters, where only the order differs, we shoud have a better translation ...

The term "outstanding" has many possible French translation in google (https://translate.google.com/#auto/fr/outstanding), but none of them express the order on Update Date.  
And same remark for the translation of "common.concepts.unresolved" ... the order of the filter is not visible in the translation.

What is sure, is that these both translation should not be the same.

My proposal would be 

{code}
common.filters.outstanding=Non r\u00E9solues et mises \u00E0 jour r\u00E9cemment
common.concepts.unresolved=Non r\u00E9solues par priorit00E9s
{code}

Except these 2 last key words,the other corrections have been also proposed in https://translations.atlassian.com .

Regards
Vincent
fields.summary: Some French corrections in Project Issue View

fields.description:
We have a saved filter which we are using to display matching issues in a list view. The query / saved filter is :-

project = "Guidewire UK" AND status != Closed ORDER BY status DESC, priority DESC

We are then trying to add two additional columns to the issues displayed via the 'Columns' button and selecting the two additional columns we want displayed. This works OK and we can also reorder the columns on the screen. However if we navigate away from the issue search screen and then come back again the column selections have reverted back to the original set and the two new columns we added are missing and need to be added back in again.

The two fields we are adding are both Custom Fields. If the query is modified to explicitly include one of the custom fields it then 'sticks' and subsequent searched using the saved filter displays the new column without the need to re-add it. So using the following query :-

project = "Guidewire UK" AND status != Closed AND ("Business Area" is EMPTY OR "Business Area" is not EMPTY) ORDER BY status DESC, priority DESC

results in the Business Area field 'sticking' for future queries once it has been added the first time. From what I can see there should be no need to explicitly refer to a field in the query in order to make it 'stick' for future queries.
fields.summary: Column Selection Not 'Sticking' For Issue Table Queries

fields.description:
JIRA Cloud ships with a plugin called Jira Suite Utilities. When you enable it, you can't save inline edit fields on blur.

Steps to reproduce:
# Enable the JIRA Suite Utilities plugin.
# Create a Service Desk, and view an issue in Agent view (the URL should look something like https://blah.jira.com/servicedesk/agent/DESK/queues/1/DESK-2
# Click on the priority field, edit it and click away (not on the save button). 
# Normally, this saves the field. In Agent View, nothing happens and the console reports {{Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'BlurTriggerMapping' of undefined}}.

Furthermore, JIRA.Events.INLINE_EDIT_STARTED stops propagating up, which can have serious consequences for any other plugins who are listening for it.
fields.summary: Inline edit fields do not save on blur in Service Desk when Jira Suite Utilities is enabled

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40477].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Currently if you forward a mail as an attachment, for example using the desktop version of Microsoft Outlook or Thunderbird, it shows up in a JIRA issue as a file with no extension containing a MIME formatted file containing xhtml with MS Office's extensions. Because there is no extension, clicking on the file does not open it in the appropriate way.

*Note 1*: The same issue appears to occur when we attach the msg file without using the forwarding functionality in Outlook. In this case as well, Outlook does not include the file extension in the attachment.

*Note 2*: If the same mail attachment was sent to Jira via the mail web browser, the file extension exists in the original email and the .msg file can be viewed correctly.
h3. Suggested Solution

Adding a check to rename such a file to be called .eml or .msg would give the necessary hint required for a mail program to successfully open such an attachment.
h3. Cause

Attaching an email in a client such as Gmail will provide a filename for the attachment, for example:
{noformat}
Content-Type: message/rfc822; name="test.eml"
Content-Disposition: attachment; filename="test.eml"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64
...
{noformat}
Attaching an email in Outlook provides no name or filename for the attachment:
{noformat}
Content-type: message/rfc822
Content-disposition: attachment
{noformat}
As a result JIRA doesn't know what to name this file.
h3. Workaround
 * use the web version of Outlook or use another email client (Gmail, etc)
fields.summary: Allow forwarded email attachments to be detected by JIRA mail handler and renamed to .eml or .msg

fields.description:
The message regarding discarding and publishing draft workflows sits at the top of the workflow editor.  And seems to be the standard state whenever you edit a workflow.

The fact that there is a warning message at the top makes you feel like you have to take a an action. You want to make warning messages go away right?

 I read it several times and I still had no idea what I was supposed to do.   Am I supposed to be editing a draft? Should I publish it then continue editing?  Should I discard then re-edit? After much deliberation and clicking on things, as far as I can tell your not supposed to do ANYTHING until you have actually finished editing. 

Lets also add in the fact that it is a similar message to what you get in Confluence when you have draft pages. So it is tempting to just go "oh i don't care about that draft I did last week, let me press the discard button to make this message go away".  And then it subsequently deletes the changes you have just been making.
fields.summary: Workflow editor draft message is really really confusing

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the latest releases, the "Attach Screenshot" button was changed from the Applet, to a screen within JIRA to attach an image.

When copying the image from the body of an email viewed in a mail client, the image is not pasted when copied from some Clients (in special Outlook 2010 and 2013).

h3. Environment
h3. Mail Clients tested:

- Outlook 2010, 2013.
- Mozilla Thunderbird.
- MacOS mail Client.

h3. Browsers:

- Google Chrome.
- Internet Explorer.
- Mozilla Firefox.

h3. Steps to reproduce:

- Configure an IMAP mail account in one Outlook 2010 or 2013 mail client.
- Send a test email to this account, with an image in the mail body.
- Create a test JIRA issue with the Attach Screenshot enabled.
- Copy the image from the mail body to the clipboard.
- Paste the image in the Attach Screenshot screen.

h3. Actual Results
Using a different behaviour of Browser+Mail Client a different behaviour is thrown, but none of them seems to work with Outlook:

# *Outlook + Internet Explorer:* The screen blinks, and nothing happens.
# Outlook + Google Chrome: Internal Server error:
!Screenshot 2014-10-17 13.41.45.png|thumbnail!
-- The following can be found in the access-log:
{noformat}
10.10.10.2 825x1659x1 psouza [17/Oct/2014:13:45:55 -0300] "POST /rest/internal/1.0/AttachTemporaryFile?filename=undefined&atl_token=BM7Y-K1FW-MAFQ-M1OK%7C5151bee917bf7685fd445575f58dc428d4dca0d9%7Clin&issueId=10300&secureToken=2b051fa2cad3e3dd86950f153092bc538d57ca8f&formToken=8fc721f4120e75b3d89c03ec68af7ebb7879f02f HTTP/1.1" 500 106 8 "http://10.10.10.1:8090/servicedesk/agent/TEST/queues/5/TEST-6" "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.3; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/37.0.2062.124 Safari/537.36" "j7a2l0"
{noformat}
# Outlook + Firefox: Nothing Happens.
{noformat}
10.10.10.2 837x1823x1 psouza [17/Oct/2014:13:57:36 -0300] "POST /rest/internal/1.0/AttachTemporaryFile?filename=undefined&atl_token=BM7Y-K1FW-MAFQ-M1OK%7C77f448de797ca920d85b0012d073f066becc9260%7Clin&issueId=10302&secureToken=94316f1e84cd9cf06db47f83b520f33d35bb2986&formToken=f7cc044208b178dedc16d0cd4731bade49e54492 HTTP/1.1" 500 106 6 "http://10.10.10.1:8090/browse/TEST-8" "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.3; WOW64; Trident/7.0; Touch; MASAJS; rv:11.0) like Gecko" "1hwb5c"
{noformat}
# Thunderbird + Internet Explorer: Internal Server error, nothing in the logs.
# Thunderbird + Google Chrome: Seems to work.
# Thunderbird + Firefox: Nothing happens.
# Mac mail + Chrome, Firefox and Safari: Works beautifully.

Using the Applet provided in the previous versions (6.1) for attach screenshot, copying the screenshot from within any mail client works smoothly.

h3. Notes
It sounds like a minor problem, however in some projects that the developers works a lot with email and images, it's a problem for the end user.

h3. Expected Results
Attach screenshot feature should be able to copy images directly from mail clients.

h3. Workaround:

Save the image locally and attach to the JIRA issue.
fields.summary: Attach Screenshot can't copy images from Mail Client.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40458].
  {panel}

If the 'Log Work' field is present in a Transition and information is added, this information is not directly indexed and thus does not display in List View of the Issue Navigator.

If you log work on an issue without during a transition it will be properly updated.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Create a new project (ex. Simple issue tracking)
# Add a Screen to one of the transitions
# Add the 'log work' field to this transition
# Create an Example issue
# Transition this issue and enter 4h for the time spent
# Go to search and find this issue. 
# Make sure you're in list view and 'Time Spent' column is displayed

Result: No work is displayed in the 'Time Spent' column.
Adding a work log again (ie 5 minutes) will update the index correctly and it will now show 4h5m.

*Workaround*
Log work outside of Transitions.
A background re-index will properly show all the columns.
fields.summary: Work logged during a transition is not indexed and is not displayed in issue search

Hi,

When you share a jira with multiple users, an individual email is sent to each person. Is there any way to have an email send that essentially cc's everyone in the one email. i.e.: One email is sent to all users so once the email is received, user A can see that user B, user C and user D also received the mail. User A can therefore include all users on a reply.

it would be good to have this as an option when sending JIRAs.

Thanks
Louise

  {panel}

h3. Current Behaviour
User who are not member of the JIRA Users Global Permission will not have the permission to create a dashboard. JIRA System Administrator and JIRA Administrators can't  create dashboard without adding them to JIRA Users Global Permission. The users without the JIRA Users Global permission will be redirected to the login page despite they have already logged in.

h3. Expected Behaviour
There should not be a permission to create a dashboard. If the permission is really required, it should throws error saying *Permission JIRA User is required to create Dashboard* rather than redirecting the user to the login page without having any further information. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
1. Remove a user from the JIRA Users Global Permission 
2. Go to create Dashboard
3. Redirected to a login page without error message, username and password will not work if the user is not in the JIRA User's global permission

h3.Workaround
Add the user to the JIRA Users Global Permission
fields.summary: Avoid the need to have to "JIRA Users Global Permission" in order to create a Dashboard

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-40445].
  {panel}

As it stands the Permission scheme structure revolves around a whitelist format. However, there should be some sort of functionality to remove abilities for a certain group of people, outside of a larger group.

For instance, everyone who is added to our JIRA instance is automatically added to jira-users. All jira-users have permissions to browse projects (amongst other things) in the default notification scheme. This simplifies things because users when created are always added to this group. However, there is a small group of people we don't want to give the ability to browse all projects to.

In our default permission scheme - that is assigned to fifteen projects - we allow 'jira-users' to 'browse projects', and would like to exclude one group from this list - a group have permissions to browse another project in our JIRA instance which has it's own permission scheme giving them the ability to do so.

In essence, we have a group of people we only want to give access to one project, but because they are in the 'jira-users' group, and our default scheme is based around that for convenience, they have access to all projects. So, there should be some way of excluding a group from a permission, just as there is the ability to give a group permissions.

Thanks
fields.summary: Permissions Schemes should have the ability to Blacklist & Whitelist

fields.description:
Let's assume there is an issue called ABC-4 (ID: 10015) that user Fred doesn't have permission to see.

State of things before https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-36368:
If Fred tried issue ID 10015 in any of JQL clauses like:
issue != 10015
issue in (10014, 10015)
issue not in (10014, 10015)
issue > 10015
issue >= 10015
issue < 10015
issue <= 10015
he used to get an error and the query wouldn't run.

After fixes for JRA-36368, we no longer load each issue individually to make sure they exist. As a side effect the permission check on the clause is gone. The permission filter is applied when the query runs.

Now, as long as issues exist they can participate in JQL clauses. As a result, these queries return what user expects:
issue != 10015: returns other issues, even though the user can't see this particular one
issue in (10014, 10015): returns only 10014
issue not in (10014, 10015): returns everything else, except these two issues

BUT, these queries still don't return anything:
issue > 10015
issue >= 10015
issue < 10015
issue <= 10015
fields.summary: Inequality JQL clauses require permission on the issue specified in the clause

fields.description:
Jira prompted me to change my time zone, and brought me to a profile that seems to be for a completely different user (who happens to share my first name and last initial). See attached screen shot.

Going directly to https://secretlocation.atlassian.net/secure/ViewProfile.jspa shows me the proper profile.

fields.description:
h4. Actual behavior:

If you edit a Field Configuration and set the Attachment field to be hidden. Users will not be able to Attach files when creating an issue, but if the use the _More > Attach Files_ then they can attach files.

The Attachment will show up in the issue. According to our documentation, that's okay.

However, if you use try to retrieve the attachment details from REST, the Attachment field is not shown.

h4. Steps to reproduce:

# Edit the Field Configuration associated with the Project.
# Set the Attachment field to be Hidden.
# Open an Issue that contains an attachment or if none, attach a file to an issue.
# You will see the Attachment on the Screen, but no information on the REST endpoint for the issue:

!Screen Shot 2014-10-15 at 3.13.52 PM.png!

And the REST does not retrieve the attachment details:
